definition: to make an error of judgment/to be taken in
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: I'm terribly sorry. I took the salt for sugar.
sentences.chinese: 真對不起了，我看走眼了，我把食鹽當成白糖了。

definition: a mistake/an oversight/an error of judgment
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to misinterpret what one sees or reads/to misjudge (sb)/to mistake (sb for sb else)/to misread (a document)
to know what's what
to blunder/to miscalculate/miscalculation/unwise (move)
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to miscalculate/miscalculation
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately

experienced and knowledgeable (idiom)
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
to blame sb wrongly
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
